Reviews.Title: As good as units twice the price
Reviews.Author: Wally "Wally"
Reviews.Content: I recently took a 400 mile round trip with my Cobra and I was very pleased in fact it saved me twice from getting a $180 ticket so it more than paid for it self two times over. False alerts are very rare and it's very obvious by the strength that it's from a store. On a straight run on the highway I get about a two mile or more warning. On hills and curves that is cut down quite a bit but still enough time to slow down. I love the extra features like the compass and intellimute. The usb port for the gps module is great to have if I ever want red light camera capability. The size is a little longer that other radar detectors but the suction cup mount seems stronger that the $350 Escort I had and the unit does not shake like the Escort did. The coiled cord is nice and is a perfect length for my car. A long straight cord is available if anyone needs that.Overall I'm very happy with the Cobra. It looks great and works great. What more can you ask for? Buy it. You'll like it.(Update)After enjoying the XRS 9945 for a couple of weeks I decided to get the red light gps module. Although I haven't taken any trips yet that encounter red light cameras, I really like being able to put in my own user alerts (up to 1000) and having my speed and more accurate compass available. I feel I have the complete package now.(Second Update)I don't know why people are bashing Cobra radar detectors. The XRS 9945 has worked as well as an Escort 8500 I had a while back plus it has tons of useful features. I read about a $500 Bell and how it knows the difference between non police signals and police radar (different freq's). My Cobra does that at one quarter the price. I had a low end Cobra from Walmart and a mid range Whistler and they were both junk. The only time they would alert to a police radar is when you were withing 100 ft. However they alerted to everything else. The Cobra XRS 9945 is not in that class at all. It is so quiet sometimes I think it's not working. It seems the way I have it configured, the only time it alerts is when it's a cop. Isn't that what we want from a detector? It is a quality, reliable product with tons of features for a great price.

Reviews.Title: You need this!
Reviews.Author: FauxStar "fauxstar"
Reviews.Content: Saved a tone of money with this. I'll be honest and I am sorry for this, but I do speed on freeways in America. Sorry, but in my opinion speed limits are way too low here. It's hard to drive on Autobahns with no speed limits one day, and then the next thing you know, you live in America and you have to live with 55/65 mph. So to cut the chase, I've purchased this unit to avoid tickets and to replace my previous lower end Cobra that had a lot of false alarms.Summary:Fake alarms reduced by 90% (besides funny moments such as warning me of Train and Railroad when going to Safeway)Voice warning comes handyDetects highway patrol/cops from far far away, including their most advanced guns, thus saving you a fortune.Beware some officers know their job well: Will not protect you from those smart officers, who know how to ticket you by tailgating you. No detector will help you against that one. Trust me I got ticket that way.Checked legality with friend of mine who is an Officer and found out that these are not illegal in California. BUT:Keep on mind that seeing one in your car will certainly NOT make Officer happy, and it WILL put you in A bad light.To conclude: Well paid off investment. I was supposed to be ticketed dozen of times w/out this. At least I am honest and hope that helps. But don't be me. I still don't encourage you to you to speed and drive unsafely. Be smart, at the end of the day all that speeding, will save you only 2-3 minutes. I  promise to change, too.:)P.S. If in need for speed: Go to the race track.

Reviews.Title: It's RADAR detector, not a police detector
Reviews.Author: N. Earwood
Reviews.Content: I can't justify paying more than $100 dollars for a RADAR detector. This one does the job fine. All RADAR detectors will give false alarms for door openers, etc., since they use the same frequencies. Also, officers have to have their RADAR on for your detector to work. Some of the reviews on here whined about police officers being right next to them and it not going off.For a cheap RADAR/LIDAR detector, the Cobras work just like they should. They cannot do magic, and neither can the $400 ones. The only advantage to the more expensive ones are if they come with remote mounted (front and rear) sensors. Otherwise, it's the same technology for 4x times the price.

Reviews.Title: Works great when u have it set up the right way
Reviews.Author: Frederick Rivera "Slickrick"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this product for well over 3 months already n at first it was not senstive bit when I started to play around with the setting I found it to be very senstive... When I first got it had a hard time picking up the ka band. But since now I have set it up the right way. I usually pick up the ka band from 2 to 3 miles away. And the laser from a cop about a mile away. It's a really good radar detector and I recommend you to get it but I will say you have to play with the settings before you use it. If anyone has any questions just as me I'll glady help you out...

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: K. Keil
Reviews.Content: i researched many sites and this seemed to be the best deal. i bought this for my boyfriend, who by the way has had plenty of speeding tickets. since he had gotten this product he has not gotten one and has avoided getting one when he was speeding and his detector went off. he really likes the city/highway setting. he sometimes drives around to find cops to make sure that it works. it has gone off everytime!

Reviews.Title: Great detector but, not for the Novice
Reviews.Author: whO "ShocK"
Reviews.Content: This is a very well designed Cobra 14 band radar/laser detector. It has multiple functions of which can be turned on or off.Some earlier reviews remarked that it is too sensitive, Thats not true, reading the instructions is a must for this detector as it is not just a basic plug and play.Yes you can just plug it in but you have the option of adjusting it for your driving conditions.The intelimute shuts the detector off when the engine rpms fall below a certain level.This eliminates a constant warning while you are sitting still.The voice feature is nice. It can be turned off or on.I found it odd that it begins with a female voice saying " system ready" and afterwards the warnings are male voices.I would not recommend this as a first detector because it's features would overwhelm a novice.But for the seasoned detector user, this is a great detector to have.It has a built in memory that will store any settings you make to the detector when the power is turned off,I have owned several detectors in the past both cobra and whisper and I am very pleased with this model.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price.
Reviews.Author: James A. Bassett
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start off by saying, " for a hundred bucks, it aint too bad!" It doesn't have the best range, but it does have a good deal of features to play with. It actually doesn't false too much more than other detectors I own (bel 955, whistler pro 78). Definately has less range than those two, but at least it mutes itself without having to push a button like the bel! That to me is a big issue. Reaching up to the window to push a little button while driving can be a little hazerdous! HaHa. It does have nice tones to it's alarms unlike the screeching bel and is fairly loud. It does have a nice coiled cord unlike the whistler which uses a straight one that flops around in front of my radio. The display can be tough to see in daylight at times. It seems to me, Cobra is just putting a product out there to make max profit! Where bel and whistler seem to put more emphasis on quality and performance. And the prices reflect it. That's really the difference here! Like I said, it's not bad for the price, and it really does detect radar albeit from less range than most. So if you're budget doesn't allow more expensive units, I'd say this isn't a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: A real good deal ... here's more helpful info ...
Reviews.Author: Odey
Reviews.Content: COBRA has been this family's choice for years.  Got this one for the wife to replace another COBRA that didn't cover some of the newer bands ... everyone liked it so much, we upgraded the other 2 drivers to this unit.Chose it because it had the range and features w/o the stuff that costs more that we didn't care about ... touch screen, GPS speed trap and stop-light notification (although it is an available option on this unit), stuff like that.It's always that speed sign you missed due to a large vehicle, or poor positioning, or the one time you are not paying as much attention that you normally do that you get snagged.  I hate that!  They've already paid for themselves by alerting all of us of impending trouble (even when FHP parks past a bridge, angling their cruiser up to transmit his beam in the air across I-75 / Alligator Alley), we still get enough of a warning to make sure we are compliant and safe (because we are not driving 90 - 95 like everyone else).Yeah, we get some false "POP" radar alerts, but I've attributed those to the presence of vehicles with "leaky" detectors (since I try to pay attention when driving, scanning approaching vehicles for light-bars, lights behind the windshield / grill and the such)  I've decided I'd rather hear a few false alerts than get hit by one for not having "POP" turned on.CAUTION:  It is not set up to its fullest potential "out of the box", you'll have to enable some alerts to have it do all it can do for you (I suspect a conspiracy, because I've found this true of different brands of detectors that I've purchased over the years ... and this could be why some reviewers gave this one low ratings).So if you get one, or any brand for that matter, DO NOT RELY ON THEIR FACTORY DEFAULT SETTINGS!  Take the time to RTFM (READ THE !@#$% MANUAL).  Otherwise, you will be running with a "FALSE SENSE OF SECURITY" and could get ticketed unnecessarily!!!

Reviews.Title: Great and gets the job done
Reviews.Author: mustanggeek
Reviews.Content: I bought this detector about a month ago and I am very satisfied. I live in a rural area and the only radar I have seen is the Ka band. I mostly bought this because my 2004 Ford Mustang doesn't have cruise control...crazy right...but anyways I didn't want to be caught when accidentally speeding along the many long winding roads I travel daily. For the Ka band radar guns this detector is amazing. It spots the gun about a mile away. However, the thing to note is it works this good when the speed gun is pointed in your general direction. If the cop is monitoring the other side of the road it will give you a warning within about a half mile to quarter mile away. This is usually when you can visually see the cop, but he's not interested in you anyway so that is more than enough time to slow down. As far as false alarms, this does pick up a few automatic doors and random interference every now and then, but the city mode works great to limit the false alarms. This is my first radar detector and if I ever need another I will definitely be going with another Cobra.P.S: One thing that worried me was when I first got the unit there were some cops that it wouldn't pick up. However, I found out that not all cops keep theirs on when they are driving around and some even don't when they are sitting in the median looking like they are monitoring people. So when it is needed it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Something Old, Somethings New!
Reviews.Author: John Owens "CoolBreeze"
Reviews.Content: The XRS 9845 continues the strong Cobra tradition of excellent sensitivity to speed detection, which is, after all, why we really buy these things. The combined audible/visible alerts are instantaneous and clear, and the Voice Alert feature removes the need to memorize which alert tone goes with which band... no small consideration when you're dealing with 15 bands. Of the six Cobra detectors that I have now owned, this unit's IntelliShield feature makes it the absolute best at blocking spurious alerts from "leaky" detectors in nearby cars as well as from things like automatic door openers and cell phone towers.Thanks to the on-screen/voice prompts and the well-done owner's manual, customizing the programmable features is a snap. I love loud music on my Bose system when I'm in the car alone, and I could have used a note in the advertising about the decibel level of alerts at full volume. My primary problem with radar detectors has historically been difficulty seeing the display when bright sunlight was washing over it, but the blue ExtremeBright graphics on the XRS 9845 have resolved this for me.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 9945
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Pros:"LCD display"Great detectionTons of featuresAccurate compassGreat alert distance also shows the proximity of how close they areAble to Change colors of the LCDCons:Large for a radar detector. Width is standard but it's a little longer than most.A longer power cord would be nice to conceal wires.Resetting the compass on occasionAfter using the blue color scheme with the brightness level on "bright" for a month or two the city and high way symbol are lightly burned into the screen. Which means it's either a low quality LCD or it's not a lcd at all.Needs to be a little bit louderConclusion:Cobra products are either a hit or miss. This is definitely one of the hits. Great overall performance, has great features with a few short comings, and surely helps prevent getting speeding tickets. At this price point this is a great value overall.

Reviews.Title: Impressive!
Reviews.Author: Zeus
Reviews.Content: I've owned a few radar detectors over the years, some worked well some didn't, either way I've still always nervously and constantly looked around for cops. I took at 1600 mile round trip vacation a week after I got my new Cobra. I started the same old way staring at every car, under bridges, behind bushes. Nothing. I was wondering if it was working, I'm used to my radars in the past beeping all the time, when nothings around. Then it beeped, faster and faster, the numbers escalated, and sure enough between some damn bushes, there was a trooper. Saved. A while later I heard some strange sound, slowed down, 10 seconds later, an unmarked trooper. This happened multiple times on the way. What I realized on the way back is that it doesnt beep at false alarms, it doesnt beep at anything other than cops with radar guns. I finally for the first time, was able to trust my Cobra, and enjoyed my trip and didn't have to sit with my eyes peeled to the road looking for cops. I actually completely stopped looking for cops and let me guard down, as the few more times it went off there was a cop within a mile or two away.Man... for less than $90, I feel like I bought the best detector on the market.  A big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: cobra xrs 9645
Reviews.Author: David Goodman
Reviews.Content: comes set up right out of the boxvery easy to use and set up just the way you want . works great very few false alarms. great radar detector for the price. if you by this radar detector im sure you will be as happy as I am with it since there are so many out there to pick from. the windshild mount is a little to small  and the radar detector is about 6in long so it tends to bounce around over bumps. but all in all its well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Josh D. Ladd
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to get a radar since i purchased my new car and looked for several weeks before i purchased this model. I did not want to spend the 499.99 for the "best" one so after reading the specs on this i went ahead and bought it. It does give some false signals sometimes but it has saved me atleast 4+ times so far, and in my book that means it has paid for itself. I would highly recommend this product for anyone looking for a reliable and fair priced model.

Reviews.Title: It will pay for itself
Reviews.Author: kem
Reviews.Content: Just tried this out on an out of town trip today. After traveling through 3 states I had the opportunity to see what it could really do. I've used it in the city but since it will alert you to so many different bands it was hard for me to determine if it was really effective at picking up police radars. The device can be set to exclude certain types of radar so that you will get fewer alerts but I decided to turn everything on since I was testing the device. Well after today I can confidently say it does work. Of course I'm not admonishing unsafe driving but sometimes I like to drive a little over the speed limit especially if I'm on a long trip. The xrs already paid for itself because it saved me from 2 tickets at least. The radar detector picked up on 2 speed traps with ample time for me to react and slow down. I was also impressed with the range. One officer was set up almost 50 to 60 yards from the highway with his vehicle facing the oncoming traffic. The detector gave me at least 10 seconds of notice before I even saw him. I had to keep looking to see if it was a false alarm after it started beeping. He was that far away. Anyway this is an excellent purchase and it will pay for itself in saved tickets. Just remember to drive safely even if you decide to drive over the limit now and then.

Reviews.Title: Great radar for the money!
Reviews.Author: G. Miller "G Miller"
Reviews.Content: I got this radar detector after doing research on them for a few days. It was the best value out there for a radar that picks up so many different bands of radar. Thing thing has already saved me a few times from Sergeant D-bag. If you are looking for a good radar, then pick this bad boy up.Note: Automatic doors may set off your radar. I get false alerts on city mode maybe 2 to 3 times a day in extremely busy areas with lots of stores that have automatic doors.

Reviews.Title: Road tested and passed!!!
Reviews.Author: Paul Braun
Reviews.Content: This is the best radar detector I have owned.  I love the way that it indicates what type of radar it is sensing, as well as the strength of the signal.  It auto mutes, but keeps you aware of the continuing signal much quieter, and with the visual.  I love that the suction cups supplied with it are of a good quality, and are not constantly coming off!  The only problem I had with it was that the instruction booklet was too small to easily read, but I emailed Cobra about that, and they enlarged the book on their copy machine and sent it to me!  Great service!!!

Reviews.Title: It's working great!
Reviews.Author: levon83 "Levon S."
Reviews.Content: I never had such a thing to compare with, and was surprised when it worked, worked great (like other products from this manufacturer!). Can't say anything about the range of detection except that I was able to slow down when needed and in time! The only thing that annoys is false detections in the city, even in "city" mode there is lots of them. Overall I like it much, and will recommend to my friends!EDITED 10.2012This is almost few years I am using this device, and I have some new info that may apply also to other devices of this kind: we have newly installed radars in our city on the streets and I noticed that first few days I had firm strong detection signal when approaching them, but later after few days (maybe when they were calibrated for traffic or smth) signal became 1-2 points and not more. Sometimes it reacts on radars placed in police cars with a strong signal, other times it shows no radars. The conclusion is that or my device is old/defective/malfunction or smth else or there are so many cases with real life radars that buying a detector in just a case of chance :)

Reviews.Title: Perefect in all generalities
Reviews.Author: William White "Zac White"
Reviews.Content: Bought this item after looking over many other different detectors. And decided on this one. Had a little trouble with hard hard wiring it to the under the hood fuse box but figured it out after a little tweaking. After that had no problems. Product had me extremely satisfied with its performance. Very sensitive when its needed to be, granted not many if any false alarms. And the programing the product allows just adds to another great aspect to this radar detector. Great price, great buy...

Reviews.Title: Functional Radar.
Reviews.Author: Peace
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Text display, very helpful.- Good product at reasonable price.- Very few false alarms.- Automatic mute.Cons:- Digital Compass is not reliable, constantly need calibration at least once a week.- The power cord. I prefer a straight power cord versus the standard flex cord.Not sure if this last one is a con or not but the emergency vehicle warning does not always activate when an emergency vehicle is approaching or passing.  Not sure if it's the emergency vehicle system or the radar.  Either way it does not impact the original purpose of this radar, which is to locate police radars.  A caveat I can live with.

Reviews.Title: I love my Cobra radar detector
Reviews.Author: Zorine Brodacz
Reviews.Content: I Love my Cobra radar detector. It has kept me from getting tickets.I have read many complaints about the mounting and the cord. These people are crazy.The weight of the Cobra is minimal. It is not heavy at all. The cord attaches with no problems.Nor have I had any problems with the suction cup mount, it holds the cobra well. It has never come off.I highly recomend this product to anyone with a lead foot. lol

Reviews.Title: worked great but the cops can detect it
Reviews.Author: vuk
Reviews.Content: i had this radar for over 4 months it worked its purpose in the united states, but the radar detectors are legal here so it wasent a big deal of being detected, few weeks back i went on a road trip to montreal canada and on the border of ontario and quebec a cop detected the radar and we hid at as soon as we seen the cop comming up on as and they searched the car and found it so this radar detector is very detectable and the fine was 648$ for some reason so if your planning on going to canada beware, also it saved us alot of tickets untill 1 cop took action

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Ashly
Reviews.Content: After recently upgrading to a bright red sports car I realized that with my lead foot, I needed to upgrade my 5 year old radar detector. Cobra is a great brand, they can be a little pricey but it's well worth the money. I've had this model for about a month and I've already tested it on a road trip all over California. It saved me from a few tickets so it's already paid for itself. One of the things I really like about this detector is that the screen turns off after a minute and when it does detect something, the screen lighting up can catch your attention even if you don't have the sound on. You can also set it to ignore certain signals so you don't have as many false alarms. This is really a pro for me since there are a few places on my way to work that set off the K alert and my old detector had no ignore option. Overall, I'm very happy with this detector and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Accurate, Sensitive & Safe
Reviews.Author: stormking
Reviews.Content: This radar detector has as many or more features than units costing two to three times more.  It responds to all types of radar currently in use by police including "POP" & provides 360 degree detection from all types of laser guns.  The XRS-9945 is immune to the VG-2 radar, "Spectre I," & provides alerts when VG-2 & "Spectre I/IV" are in use.  The XRS-9945 also provides detailed messages from Cobra's exclusive Safety Alert & Strobe Alert warning systems that activate red lights at traffic intersections in emergency high speed situations.  Be sure to follow the compass setting instructions carefully.  I had to recalibrate mine on two different occasions to finally get it right.  The display is very bright, colorful, & highly visible in all light situations.  Very comprehensive package for the money.  Call Cobra customer service & have them send you a set of rubber windshield mounts.  The shiny, black plastic ones that came with the unit didn't work well for me.

Reviews.Title: Full featured without the full price
Reviews.Author: Lawrence S. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical in purchasing a less than a 300 dollar Escort. I have the 8500 Escort and after 10 years of faithful service is displayed "service required". I had the option of paying 80 dollars to get this fix, but granted, I was getting a 10 year detector.  I am what you call a consumer advocate and always do extensive research on all the products I buy and after extensive research, settled on this. Well, after just one day, I was "POP"ed, KA, and one other that I can't recall at this time. I have a SC400 that to tell you the truth, am always going over the speed limit. I haven't received a ticket in 30 years and have always had the most expensive radar detector, but to tell you the truth, this is a full featured radar detector and I couldn't be happier with this choice. I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants all the features, without paying the full price. I hope this helps. I am very, very pleased with the ease of setup. FORGET the manual, use it for only as a reference as the on screen menus are so user friendly that I just turned the unit on and went through the menus. It couldn't be any easier. Good luck in your decision and hope that this helps with those who are interested in purchasing a less than the most expensive unit out there. PEACE~

Reviews.Title: GREAT JOB!!!
Reviews.Author: Vanessa L. Owen "Chewie26"
Reviews.Content: This detector works great!! Took me from Chicago to Seattle with no tickets!! I used the POP feature and wow I knew there was a cop before they could see me! I also loved the speedy delivery. I would recomend this item for the busy traveler.

Reviews.Title: Best radar detector I have purchased in a while
Reviews.Author: Delano F. Jardine
Reviews.Content: I actually purchased the Cobra XRS 9445 for my wife. she loves it its very sensitive when it comes to any detection or radar beam being picked up In my area the police has gone while in cutting down on seat belts, cell phones and speeders. It lets her know way in advance who is gunning for her if when goes over the speed limit. Also I brought this item at a real bargain. I am hoping to get one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Cobra Radar Detector
Reviews.Author: newkid7
Reviews.Content: I purchased this radar detector for use in my truck. Used it on a trip to Denver, Colorado. It detected every State Patrol that had a radar. I was able to cover a large amount of miles (800 miles) with no speeding tickets. Great investment.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Flybouy "Marshall"
Reviews.Content: Great price and quick shipping.  I like the way the unit alerts then the sound volume lesses considerabley after the initial alert.  It gets your attention but doesn't aggrevate by a constant load alert.

Reviews.Title: Saved my butt three times within a week!!
Reviews.Author: J. P. Dorsett "d2iq"
Reviews.Content: Great little product.  Sensitive and completely reliable.  Withing the first week, I was saved from a ticket three times in Arizona.  Great product and a very competitive price.

Reviews.Title: short power cord
Reviews.Author: K. G. Dougal
Reviews.Content: I recently bought model XSR9945, first it is big and heavy. The windshield suction cup is a terrible design, it won't hold up the unit and the suction cups won't stick to the windshield ( there too small). The power cord is too short to reach my windshield in a Subaru Outback. The power cord should be a straight cord, without the curls  to reach and maybe put out of the way to your vision (if you can get it to stay on the windshield, mine's on the dash now). I would probably go to a store next time to see how big it is before I bought another one, size does matter !

Reviews.Title: MONEY WELL SPENT
Reviews.Author: KWC 2008
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever purchase off amazon and I couldn't have done better than to get this radar detector. Its affordable and it works and does everything it says it does. I drive back and forth from home and work every day and it's fun to hear it go off and see a cop. its like an I SPY game but with cops and you get to cheat.It has never given off a false alarm. And works well even with my car(an older model).It is money well spent and saves you money in the long run from tickets.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 9545 is a solid buy!
Reviews.Author: Joshua Joseph Jimenez
Reviews.Content: This is the first radar detector that I have purchased and I am very satisfied with the product.  I bought it based on the price and the good reviews that followed.  The detector goes off every now and then for me when I drive by certain gas stations, because their doors set it off, but it doesn't keep beeping or anything.  The times that I have seen cops, it lets you know from quite a bit away that their radar is near.  I have had no problems with connections or functionality.  I would only recommend spending a lot more money on a radar detector if you are doing some serious speeding all the time.For those of us that like to speed every now and then and have gotten tickets for it, this is a great product to help ease getting caught speeding.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS Radar/Laser detector
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: This is a good product...once you read the directions and learn how to work it properly. I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: BigAL332
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to anyone else posting a negative review about this detector. It is probably the best you are going to get for $90-$100. I mean it's worth $190! You can't get a better deal than that! Sure it may detect a few false signals, but you have to take the time to set it so that it rejects those false signals. Sorry if I offend anybody who is having trouble with it, but you can't go and write one-star reviews for something that is pretty much your own fault. Read the instructions!

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 9845
Reviews.Author: Hornet
Reviews.Content: Great little unit for the price. Paid for itself in a couple days. Get a lot of alerts, not sure all are valid but would prefer 1,000 false than to miss one valid - California has gone nuts. Last ticket before I bought this was for 5mph over in San Louis County and it cost about $300 without traffic school. Be warned, here in Ca the CHP seldom drive with radar on so you don't get much warning in most circumstances just a persistent "POP", then you hope he shot the guy down the road.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad buy
Reviews.Author: Western Mass.
Reviews.Content: Purchased a Whistler 1730 from Amazon several years ago and worked well. Anyways, I got pulled over for speeding in my town. I am a municipal employee so luckily I knew the cop. I asked him why my radar did not go off and he said he was running LIDAR. My Whistler was only a six band I think. Got home from my vehicle stop and went right to Amazon. Found this fourteen band for reasonable money. Definitely works alot better than my Whistler. This detector has just about everything you need. My radar goes off way sooner, in town and highway. Has alot of different options like speed sensing that adjusts to your engine rpm's, road construction warning, emergency vehicles, etc. For the price for a fourteen band detector I have no regrets. I am sure there are better detectors out there, but I am confident you will pay alot more for basically a comparable detector.

Reviews.Title: What more do you need?
Reviews.Author: jeremy n
Reviews.Content: I've had the Cobra XRS for about a month now.  So far I've seen 2 or 3 highway patrol and this little guy picked them up really far away.  I love how it automatically gets a little quieter after the first couple warnings.  Nice when you are focused on the road and don't want to turn it down manually.  Ya, it does go off near automatic doors but I don't really mind it.  Buy it.

Reviews.Title: less range than my other one
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Well, I bought this one since I give my wife the other one I had. The problem I have with this one is that the range is much less than the other one I had and the signal strenght bar never gets over 1 even if you are right next to the plice car.Not a good one to have IMO. I think I'm going to return it and buy another brand.

Reviews.Title: Almost Happy
Reviews.Author: D. Smith "Tsali"
Reviews.Content: I bought this radar detector for both local and long distance use.  It works great with our local sheriff's dept and police.  But I have noticed that it does not seem to work at all around our state troopers, which is one of the reasons I bought it.  I don't get any reading when they're around - not even when they already have someone pulled over.  So, I still have to be very careful on trips.  I don't feel as confident as I wanted.  However, it has saved me many times on the way to work with our locals.  Maybe I do have to spend hundreds of dollars to cover them all.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: James Gray
Reviews.Content: This cobra has worked flawlessly.  Great value for the money.The compass calibration is more effort than it is worth but the radarwarns you long before the radar guns have you.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Cobra XRS 9945 Radar but too short of cord.
Reviews.Author: AmazonChris "dieharddiecastcollector"
Reviews.Content: I have always owned a radar detector.  They have saved me a number of times.  I purchased this one to replace my 15 year old unit which still works well.  I thought I could mount both in my truck to see which one worked better but it turned out that they alarmed one another.  So I couldn't test them against each other.  This one did go off well in advance of the officer.  If nothing else, it notifies me to be a better driver.  I thought the other reviews with the cord complaints were being too fussy but I do agree, the cord is long enough BUT it is coiled and the memory of the coil does want to pull it off the dash.  I don't like suction cups stuck to my window, and I prefer the radar to sit in a cradle I have on the dash.  I did stretch the cord out and then used in but in an hour it had returned back to its memory.Overall, excellent radar.  Cord would be better if it wasn't coiled so much.

Reviews.Title: Good range, excellent product
Reviews.Author: Andres Pineda "Andres Pineda"
Reviews.Content: This radar detector works pretty well. This device detects with a awesome range (1Km or more) LIDAR speed guns in Colombia, so, you have enough space and time to react and lower speed. I recomend it!

Reviews.Title: Good, not perfect
Reviews.Author: p0.An
Reviews.Content: I have had the device show up alerts several times by now. In particular, I was hit by 2 Lasers and one Ka band radar on a particular trip. The range is fine. It is probably not as sensitive as other the higher end V1, escorts and beltronics. However, this one is really good for experimenting. It does show up everytime before I see a cop pointing radar at me..There is nothing particularly wrong with this detector, but it is not something I would rely on. (In fact these days, theres very few detectors you could rely on, because of use of lasers and Instant-on radar). But it is a good device if you want to keep your speeding in check and want to stay alert.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: JBo
Reviews.Content: So far I have I have liked everything about the radar detector.  I like that it gets quiet after the initial alert.  There have been a couple of times when I thought it should go off and it didn't.  I am not sure why it didn't.  I think the cops were using pop radar and they must not have had it aimed at me.  Besides that I think it works well.  It has probably paid for itself already.  I have slowed down just in time at least twice now in the 3 months I have had it.

Reviews.Title: Best features, great price.
Reviews.Author: J. Gleason
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Cobra detector before. Updating the old one for this model, with the newest features was an easy decision for me. I price shopped for quite a while and could not beat this value. The packaging was done with care, and the shipping was fast. I could not be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: slow/inaccurate detect
Reviews.Author: seth "seth"
Reviews.Content: Compared to my previous Cobra radar detector, this model is much worse. A lot of time I can already visually see the police car when the alert first sounded. Sometimes they don't even react at all.....Should've gotten better model even with higher price.......

Reviews.Title: Overall Great
Reviews.Author: Winston G. Rogers
Reviews.Content: I got this because I am a volunteer firefighter and sometimes I have to travel above the speed limit to get to a call. I agree that it goes off a lot because of doors and stuff at stores but it really doesn't bother me. I got it to give me a warning to alert me when to slow down seeing as Alabama does not allow volunteer firefighters to put emergency lighting on their personal vehicles. I've encountered officers a few times in the first day I've had it and it's went off. I do however wish it has a little bit better range but it fulfills it's purpose well. Overall I think this is a great product and with a little more usage I would probably recommend it to a friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Atif Qureshi
Reviews.Content: It works great. I used it on a 6 hour trip thru OK and TX and it worked fine. Warns me about quarter of a mile in advance. Looks classy though little bit long but that doesnt bother me. Has double antennas for better reception. City mode is great as it cancels out the X signals which are most likely the cause of false alarms. Cord is little short and could become a challenege if you try to place it on the windshield and your car adapter is close to the car floor. I have mounted on the dashboard of my Honda Element with a removal valcro which is a great feature as I can remove and hide it when I want. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Uncertain...
Reviews.Author: Nicole Welch
Reviews.Content: We've never owned a radar detector before since we always assumed it would make us "lazy" drivers.  The first weekend we used it for a road trip, I got a ticket.  Although this model seemed to catch most cops we passed, the ones on Hwy. 59 in Cleveland/Shepherd, Texas evidently used a lasar type/mode not detected.It quickly attaches to dash, has an adjustable volume (great for when the kiddo naps), and it overall very easy to use.  We got it hidden before the cop made it to our car (LOL).

Reviews.Title: Radar Review
Reviews.Author: L. Milani-ingalls "Lacy"
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this detector.  ALways been a fan of Cobra and this one is not as annoying as the earlier models.  Very flexible with options, sounds, buttons.

Reviews.Title: Field Tested
Reviews.Author: jfrash
Reviews.Content: Ive been using radar detectors for sometime, and for the money, this is a no go. The "extreme range" the product says it has is very limited. The radar detector was not picking up signal until 1/8th to 1/4th of a mile from the police car. For that matter even at point blank range, the signal strength was only registering a 1. City mode will only pickup a 3 (max 5)or higher signal, but again a 1, and sometimes not even registering when you could reach out and touch the police car in an obvious radar shooting situation. That said,it did work at times but was rather inconsistent. Highway mode in the city will drive you crazy as the 14 bands are not necessary, and most police are on the x band anyhow. That said the mounted position may be the problem, in the past I have always mounted from the windshield as this one is mounted to the dash. Thus, if you do by this product I reccomend you mount from the windshield as the dash mount does not allow the product full field of view.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: Sean Schafer
Reviews.Content: Saved me a few tickets.  You do have to still pay attention, Works just like higher priced units.  I'm very happy with this detector.

Reviews.Title: Works as promised...
Reviews.Author: K. Cochran "Computer Nerd"
Reviews.Content: Just used the new Cobra XRS 3945 on a trip from Illinois to Texas and back.  The detector picked up all bands and even saved me from a trap using Laser (nice sound effect).  Biggest feature that I liked was the sound adjusting down after four beeps so that you don't have keep listening as you drive closer to the source.  As a former poster mentioned, this a Radar detector, not a Police finder.  Works as stated and was a great price from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Just ok
Reviews.Author: vince yu
Reviews.Content: Lots of faulse alert. Sometimes i see police, i did not hear anything but when i did not see any cops did alert !

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: ggabriel1226
Reviews.Content: The Cobra 9545 has distance issues, you almost need to be right up on the police cars radar before it gives you a really good reading. I have had other detectors that definitely give you more distance then this radar detector. I has alot of options but the distance issue is a factor

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Speed Racer
Reviews.Content: So far this little device has saved my rear three separate times.  Once you get use to the different settings and understand what the different alarms mean, it is a very handy must have when ever I travel now.  I would recommend this to anyone traveling on a freeway/tollway or your local highways.  As far as using it in the city, I have found it is not that useful.  Seems to give off a fair amount of false readings and tends to be annoying at times.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased ...
Reviews.Author: Nicholas E. Arpaia
Reviews.Content: I have had this unit for less than a month, but pass several speed traps daily. So far the unit seems to have good detection for radar bands, but I haven't passed a laser trap with it yet. I much prefer the Cobra's display icons & numeric signal strength indication to my old unit's LEDs.It's ability to recognize false signals (door operators, etc) is a welcome relief. Unlike my 10 year old K40, it completely rejects many false signals and gives only a single soft beep on initialization of others. (It does continue the visual indicator) Constant beeping from the K40 was really annoying. The Cobra also doesn't seem to be susceptible to other drivers' jammers/scramblers.The unit has more advanced abilities that must be programmed (like false sensing based on vehicle speed) I have not used these features because my unit is swapped between two vehicles & would have to be re-setup each time.I will be ordering a second one when I can afford it (the price is now $20 more than I paid)

Reviews.Title: Best (and probably cheapest) radar detector on the market.
Reviews.Author: Remlap
Reviews.Content: My mom and dad both have radar detectors in their cars, and I absolutely HATED them. They were incredibly noisy, annoying, and beeped at every possible thing on the road.  So when my old radar detector (mom's hand me down) broke, I looked and saw what was available, and stumbled upon this beauty.  Mine was about a hundred bucks, but was worth every penny.  First, the sound is loud, but it isn't so jarring that you want to mute it all the time.  And it has also been stated by a few commenters before me that it only beeps at cops with radar guns.  That's pretty much it.  My parents' radar detector beeped at automatic doors in grocery stores, but didn't at the cop directly across the road from them.  Would highly reccomend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: False alerts
Reviews.Author: Paulo Baptista
Reviews.Content: I have the XRS9945 just for a week, and hadn't met a real radar yet. So, I'm using it this time and noticed a lot of false alerts, although in city mode. I'm using it in Brazil, but maybe in the USA it works like here. I recommend to use the GPS module, because with this option you can report false alerts to the detector.

Reviews.Title: Love it already
Reviews.Author: Brent
Reviews.Content: All the people saying how they got a ticket with it, it didn't work, it doesn't go off when they are right next to a cop either don't know how to use it, were speeding that was COMPLETELY obvious, or don't realize it's a RADAR detector, not a COP CAR detector. I just got mine on Wednesday 2/23/12 and it already saved me 2 times when I was going 70-75 in a 60. Yes it does have false alarms and it is sensitive, but any radar that isn't above $300 will. I was actually surprised at how well it is compared to my previous Whistler, that went off on everything, whether it be a gas station or tree. I mainly got it because of the looks lol. If you are considering this, I say go for it, the price is right and it is efficient.

Reviews.Title: Works Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Has great range and has saved my butt from a ticket a few times now, lol. Great product with a great price. Really worth it.

Reviews.Title: Already saved me a lot of money
Reviews.Author: Native Pheonix
Reviews.Content: I've only used this product for a little over a week and it's already saved me money. It's also let me know when officers were hiding or in traffic near me, but in an unmarked car. I don't know how this works, but also seems to detect when a scout car is on the highway even in a ramp underneath me.It does seem to go off (mildly) nearing exit ramps and the occasional big box stores, but after the money it's saved me, I really don't mind. It also goes off and warned me approaching construction areas, when an unmarked car was stashed in with other construction vehicles. If it goes off in intersections, it's due to the stationary camera's and red light camera's.Drive safe but yes, I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Its good for its price!
Reviews.Author: iLLyNoiZe
Reviews.Content: Long story short, if your going 80 and the speed limit is 55, it will go off and give you enough time to slow down to 60-65 and thats only if the police radar is on!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This radar is good. Unfortunately, it detects many false alarms. I still have to use mine in a more frecuent way. However, you can esily differentiate if its a false alarm or not.

Reviews.Title: Good Detector - Mounting Hardware Needs Tweaked
Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: This is a very good detector - I work about 35 minutes from my house and I work until 10 and night sometimes and when I need to get up the next morning I might like to get home quicker.  This detector is very good at finding the cops (and the door openers).  One thing people say is they passed a cop with someone pulled over and it didn't go off -- well some cops have Instant On radars so they don't emit a constant signal and Instant On is factory disabled on this detector - read the instructions and turn it on first - I also turned on the Spectre detection setting and Ku band.One issue I did have was the mounting bracket for the windshield - the angle it's bent at is the angle for dashboard mounting so when you mount it on the windshield it points to the sky so I had to bend the bracket (which of course takes several tweaks to get the angle right) but other than that, it's great.

Reviews.Title: Afordable Radar Detector
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo
Reviews.Content: Low cost and good features. This Radar detector provides a low cost solution for speed an red light cameras.Robust and portable.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: manny61986
Reviews.Content: Had this for 2 years and never got pulled over.  Always let me know in time if a cop was ahead or behind.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: R. creech
Reviews.Content: i like this very much. my last one lasted me over 8 years. so far it has been picking up what it is suppose to.the compass has to be set when you get it but very easy to do. lots of bells and whistles that i don't have much use for in my small little area over all great product

Reviews.Title: Great for the money.
Reviews.Author: Emilio C Gurrea
Reviews.Content: Since most police departments use a doppler radar based gun (X, K, Ka) this detector provides more than enough time to slow down and travel with the rest of traffic. I own 2 of these, one in my company car and one in my BMW M Roadster and the only ticket I've received in since I've had these for 2 years now, was an illegal u-turn.So, don't be tempted to spend the extra money, this will do just fine.Remember, they don't work if they are not ON all the time....If you are looking for excellent laser protection, then just be vigilant and slow down, it doesn't exist. There is no doppler effect to laser, its very precise and once your tagged, well its over.

Reviews.Title: Always works, just works too much.
Reviews.Author: Marshall Terry
Reviews.Content: I have never been surprised by a cop since I got this devise but I get about 10 false alarms for every real alarm (especially in the city).  I just keep it on low volume around town and only really use it on the interstate.  It is great if you are driving interstate or highway where you don't have many buildings or much interference.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: M. Gorel "JeepManSRO"
Reviews.Content: This is a good price for something so feature packed. Comes with a curled stretch cord, not a flat one.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful and pleasurable
Reviews.Author: Frawst_byte
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to lie. Like everyone else on the road I speed, not that much, but enough to get me in some trouble. I've had this thing for less than a month and I kid you not when I say that it has saved me at least 2 dozen times. It is very reliable and I really enjoy the voice alerts as well as the beeping. I comes loaded with so many features that this product is definitely one of the best purchases I've ever made for my car. Another recommendation, that I did, is to hardwire it into the fuse box so the annoying cord is out of your way and it turns on right when your car does.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Chad Sparks "shpanky"
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift and wow, it has saved my butt already... quite a few times. I don't know how much it cost but it's worth it. Great detector!!

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: John Kessler
Reviews.Content: This product works good. Has saved me from getting many tickets.  The voice is very annoying but you can just turn that off.

Reviews.Title: DOESN'T WORK
Reviews.Author: Batman
Reviews.Content: The Cobra XRS 9945 detects only random signals from nothing really!!! I used it for a good 2 weeks driving from Tyler Tx to Dallas and there were many state troopers with their guns pointing directly at me and it gave me no alerts at all. The great thing about it is well it turned on and it gave me many FALSE ALERTS. It even gave me FALSE ALERTS in places where it is completely country and there are only trees, cows, horses, and large prairies. Its pretty easy to use, but I will not recommend it at all. First, too many FALSE ALERTS!!!!. Second, it doesn't detect Ka and K bands even if it is pointing at you (it works but only in 50-150 ft or even less). I own a Valentine One and I compared them both during my travel because this was a gift for my GF and in comparison the Valentine One detected the band from a mile away and this one did not. Third, I compared it to my older whistler pro in and the whistler pro detected the radar band from at least less than a mile away and this one WELL, it detected it when it was really close. DO NOT BUY!!!!!!Get something else and research it first before you buy.ProsBright LightsEasy to useSturdyok, featuresConsToo many FALSE ALERTS (even in the country side and my HOUSE)Detects about 50-150 ft (which causes you to have a MASSIVE FINE!!!)Suction CUP won't holdP.S.Do NOT believe in the reviews that are posted here because some of them are paid reviewers by the sellers or the sellers themselves posting as customers.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth The Money
Reviews.Author: joe godfrey
Reviews.Content: Very poor quality with picking up radar signals.  I would suggest spending more money for a detector that can alert better.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 9945
Reviews.Author: Kat R
Reviews.Content: I just got this unit a month ago. All alerts are ON and so far, despite many false alerts, it has been working well. Today I was driving from Miami to West Palm Beach taking the turnpike. There were many state troopers with their radar guns pointing directly at me and it gave me no alerts at all. When the troopers are inside the cars, the detector would pick up the signal from over a mile away, but this failure to detect their laser guns really disappointed me. I was just lucky they didn't aim at me, but if they did - I would definitely get a ticket.If any comments or advice, please let me know!Thanks

Reviews.Title: Reliable-accurate
Reviews.Author: T. Michon "TK Cape Cod"
Reviews.Content: Works precisely as we expected.  Bought for my oldest son, going to get one for me and my newly licensed son.  Speeding is a fact of life---it's how we live-better engineered cars and highways-and less time---no one drives 55---even 65---so when you don't---drive safe and turn on the radar---the money you could be saving, is your own.  Missing out on one ticket or lost day of work going to court to fight a ticket, will pay for this radar detector.

Reviews.Title: Fuzz Buster
Reviews.Author: H. LiMarzi "Seeker"
Reviews.Content: A nice unit.  Very sensitive.  While it does react to something in traffic signals, it DEFINATELY reacts to police radar!! The Voice feature cuts through clutter and lets you know something is going on.  It has saved me a number of times already; not from downright SPEEDING but from those traps where you are doing 50 in a politically marked 30MPH zone and it's GIVE SOME TICKETS day.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS review
Reviews.Author: Sophia Chironstevens
Reviews.Content: great product, I like the voice that tells me to quick step on the brakes.  it's a little annoying in the city when there are a lot of false signals, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Blinding performance
Reviews.Author: J. Plavecsky
Reviews.Content: Whatever design engineer decided to adorn the top of this otherwise great radar detector with bright chrome needs to try test driving his own design. The sun reflects from the top onto the windshield and blinds me as I am driving. The cord is also too short. This detector will work well if you plan on mounting on top off the dash. It is packed full of features and gives early warnings.

Reviews.Title: Not practical
Reviews.Author: ah.
Reviews.Content: I received  this radar detector today. I try to install it in my SUV (Lexus ) but I found out the suction cup can not hold the weight. The electric cord is also not long enough to reach the cigarette lighter's plug.

Reviews.Title: Way too many false alerts
Reviews.Author: OnlineReviewer "OnlineReviewer"
Reviews.Content: After ten days I am returning this detector to Amazon tomorrow. Gave it a good work out in country, extreme country, mid and large city driving. The number of false alerts was maddening. And I had it well mounted in a high profile vehicle with good visibility front and rear. This detector is worthless.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: hbault
Reviews.Content: This works well. Has nice high volume options. Has saved my husband from a few speeding tickets I am sure.

Reviews.Title: Cobra vs Beltronics
Reviews.Author: Marvin W Day
Reviews.Content: Not near the device that Beltonics offers!!Picks up so many false signals!!I was disappointed!! Cobra has some catching up to do.

Reviews.Title: cobra 9745
Reviews.Author: diane.o
Reviews.Content: i love this model!!worth the money this cobra will not dissappoint you its better than some of the newer models

Reviews.Title: Another great one
Reviews.Author: Matthew T.
Reviews.Content: I have owned several cobra detectors and have always been pleased with there products. Works great and its a lot cheaper than a passport or other radar detectors.

Reviews.Title: Works great, saved me a couple times already
Reviews.Author: Weiss
Reviews.Content: This isn't the Mercedes of radar detectors but if you're looking for something that picks up radar signals from 5.0 looking for speeders it does the trick.  It's sensitive enough that you should have plenty of warning time to check your speed if someone is laying in wait.  I get false alarms often when I go under bridges (don't know why) but its easy to pick up the difference between a really reading and a fake one.  The intensity levels that it shows will help keep you aware of what signals require a hard foot on the brakes and which don't.This detector does everything I want it to.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Susan Miranda
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great radar for the price. I use it to travel on highways and it has saved me several times and gives me fair warning. For my driving it works fine.

Reviews.Title: saves my husband almost daily
Reviews.Author: visorgirl
Reviews.Content: Love this, works great- no idea how much money this has saved my husband on tickets. I would put this on the recommend list.

Reviews.Title: Okay..still got a ticket due to the lack of range.
Reviews.Author: M. D. FERRELL
Reviews.Content: I bought this based on the features I read about it however it is a decent radar detector but the range is lacking as I was ticketed for speeding as the trooper was almost in front of me before this actually went off and by then it was too late.  If it is clear out and you are on a straight away etc. it seem to work better.

Reviews.Title: Great Range, but a lot of false alarms
Reviews.Author: Kaylyn
Reviews.Content: I have had a radar detector for more than 10 years now and they have drastically improved over the years.  This radar detector has a nice color display and great range, but has a lot of false alerts.  I have mine set for only K, Ka, and X band.  99% of the time the X band is a false alert.  The radar detector has many random false K and Ka alerts that it will only beep once or twice for then stop.  The cheaper Cobra radar detectors have not done that in my experience.  However, this radar detector does have excellent range and I am very pleased with it.If you live in an area with cold weather do NOT buy the Cobra XRS 9845 because the display does not work until the car is warm.  Then you have to either unplug the radar detector and plug it back in or turn it off and back on for the display to come on, but the car must be warm.  The Cobra XRS 9845 only has a blue color display and the XRS 9945 has a full color display.  Those are the only real differences I have found with the Cobra XRS 9945 and the Cobra XRS 9845.Overall, this radar detector has EXCELLENT range and I would buy another XRS 9945 in a heartbeat.  I love this radar detector and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great radar detector!

Reviews.Title: Love it and it has saved me many times from getting tickets.
Reviews.Author: Slingshot "Crash"
Reviews.Content: Love it and it has saved me many times from getting tickets. I have this model in every vehicle I own.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!!
Reviews.Author: Guadalupe Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Radar detector works great and is very affordable. Will definitely be buying more Cobra radar detectors for all my cars.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as an older Cobra which this replaced
Reviews.Author: Jason Askew
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this unit, unfortunately the amount of false alarms has gone very high.  In some cases, the K band alert is going off, with no officer in the area, for miles at a time.  In some cases, while in city mode and on the Interstate, the unit will go off continuously quickly going from 1 to 5 in a second, then recycling at 2, sometime staying at 5 for a few miles.  Very undependable in my opinion, I expected more considering all of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 9345 14-Band Radar/Laser Detector with POP-mode radar gun
Reviews.Author: Teddy Bear's Mom "americaforamericans"
Reviews.Content: Cobra XRS9345 14 band Radar/Laser Detector with Pop-mode Radar Gun  This has worked and given us plenty of warning about Sheriff and Highway Patrol as well as local police enough to pay for the detector twice over by now.  Good buy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: HarmoniousKeys
Reviews.Content: I have been using this radar-detector for a few months now. I can say with confidence that it is easily one of the best investments I have ever made. It has saved me from potentially being pulled over quite a few times!Now, the radar detector does take a bit of time to install. Also, I have noticed that there are quite a few "false flags" when using this device. However, just because you don't see a cop car immediately does not mean that they're not there. I feel that most of the false readings I receive are merely coming from patrol cars which I can't see. Not really a defect of the device.Overall, I cannot recommend this product enough. You don't need to spend hundreds of dollars on a "top-notch" one as this will do just fine for you.(Please note: I do not condone excessive speeding on the road. At most, I go only 5 mph over the speed limit. I purchased this because many highway patrol officers will give drivers a ticket for just about any infraction they can think of. Do use this responsibly.)

Reviews.Title: good while the work
Reviews.Author: Michael Griffin "Mike G"
Reviews.Content: Cobra works great for detecting radar laser etc. It will pick one up almost a mile away. The only last 1 to 4 years, the screen always go out, the speaker quits working, the volume switch breaks, the power cord breaks. So its good for a year or to. It has been worth its money in the tickets it has saved me.

Reviews.Title: Can't drive without it...
Reviews.Author: Dave Lennox
Reviews.Content: This and my TomTom GPS are my must-haves when I go anywhere. The detector has saved me from, i dunno, a JILLION tickets, and the TomTom has saved me from, I dunno, a JILLION wrong turns. Buy 'em both, stick in glovebox, save time, money and use the satellites while evading the fuzz, man.

Reviews.Title: I think it works??
Reviews.Author: neil zlozower
Reviews.Content: Had the unit for a month or so. Use it the other day on a 600 mile trip. Seems to like to go off at times when there is no officer visible but would rather go off unnecessarily than not go off at all. Going to Las Vegas next month and will give it another try

Reviews.Title: This new unit replaced my 10 year old model
Reviews.Author: Ranger Rick "Rick"
Reviews.Content: This new unit replaces my ten years old Cobra and I'll tell youit really let's you know what's going on way out in front of you !The old one was great, but this is waaaay better........have tomute the voice alert at times, for it can be a little a annoying !

Reviews.Title: Very accurate for my use
Reviews.Author: Alberto C Canda
Reviews.Content: I like the it very much specially the audio, the lights, starting signals, increases, time to slow down back to speed limit and time to normal speed limit when locked by R-guns and very accurate Cops presence. Price is so cheap and is been paid for the very first I detected a Cop and what more follows...what are you guys waiting for, very highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: Ehh..
Reviews.Author: ivang95 "Rafael"
Reviews.Content: The range on this is a bit lacking. I would have liked it to detect radar much longer. Many features included but lacks many more without the gps attachment. For about $50 more you can attain a much higher quality radar. I thought i researched this product enough but during my field test i was disappointed. Wish I could return but the SELLER does not accept returns of items that come from blister packaging, go figure. 3 stars for the product and 1.5 for the seller.

Reviews.Title: Great detector...
Reviews.Author: DHLWTU
Reviews.Content: I live in Canada and bought this in Florida to use for my ride home.  It did not let me down. It picked up multiple radar traps as well as a couple of laser traps as well.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Logan
Reviews.Content: I got this for a very decent and affordable price, I couldn't pass it up. Definitely a must have for speedracers like me lol. And to be honest Im always speeding, the speed limit just isn't fast enough. It has saved me 2 tickets  so far.-Logan S.L.C

Reviews.Title: Great value and performance
Reviews.Author: C. Huskey "Traveler"
Reviews.Content: Replaced an old Cobra model and found the improvements in the new one to be extremely effective.  Just took a 2700 mile trip and the improved road awareness was certainly helpful with numerous incidents.

Reviews.Title: Took Two Tries
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I have had detectors before and soon found this one did not work exactly right!Would pick up radar ect but would only show level 1 no matter what!Returned it to Cobra and they sent me another one right away that works GREAT!Very few false alarms and picks up from in front and behind well even with high headrests in the back.People at Cobra were great!

Reviews.Title: Falses on the Pop mode constantly
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the pop mode... and it falses all the time.  Cobra has now replaced it with the same model so we will see if my unit was just defective or what.  Very disappointing the first time around

Reviews.Title: Works ok....
Reviews.Author: Jordan A. Bourne "J.Bourne"
Reviews.Content: This unit doesn't seem to be as sensitive as it claims. I've been lucky to get a reading more than 200ft from any radar source. It also doesn't go off for railroad tracks or emergency vehicles either. Overall I am disappointed and wouldn't purchase again. YMMV, good luck.

Reviews.Title: cobra xrs 9545
Reviews.Author: steve wingard
Reviews.Content: Not sure yet, I go by a lot of police cars with no response ! Yet it is always going off by banks and large stores and intersections.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Outlawking
Reviews.Content: Good product I got mine on a tight budget heat on amazon. Overall function works amazing have picked up 5-0 for a really good distance away. I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Ed's toys
Reviews.Author: Ed's toys
Reviews.Content: I haven't installed it yet , but I have the XRS 9845 and it works perfect.  I have much better reception then other detectors I have used.  I bought the lifetime update plug in flash drive for it from Cobra.

Reviews.Title: gift purchase
Reviews.Author: Vanessa L.
Reviews.Content: recipient hasn't received item yet. I have very similar Cobra to this one. Love it! Works well and has saved me many times. Mine is also a 15 band radar.

Reviews.Title: Audio alert fails after 2 years
Reviews.Author: toasty
Reviews.Content: I've been using this unit for about 2 years without any significant problems.  Are the audio alerts annoying?  Sure.  Seems that every radar detector audio alert is.  Why couldn't they put that sexy computer voice from Start Trek in one of these babies?  What happened recently is that suddenly the little speaker in the detector started sounding very distorted and maddeningly loud even when the volume is turned way down.  I MEAN FREAKIN LOUD!!Although the detection part still seems top be working, I've got to throw this puppy away, due to the sound problem.  I suppose it could be used in silent mode, but I just don't pay that much attention to the lights when I'm driving, especially during the day.  Oh and just so you know this isn't a fluke, the same thing happened to my son's Cobra detector at about 2 years.  It's too bad the audio has such a short life.  I like the unit otherwise, but I won't buy or recommend another Cobra to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Peter Klock
Reviews.Content: I bought this detector since I was going on a 3,600 mile road trip vacation.  Last thing I needed was a ticket in a distant state.  It seemed to work flawlessly.  I knew about every speed trap well ahead of time.  The only thing I didn't understand was the "POP" alert went off quite a few times when we were in the middle of nowhere with no radar sources in sight.  I used the suction cup mount and it stayed on the entire 12 day trip, no problems with it as other reviews have stated.  Just make sure the glass is clean and push the suction cups on hard.  The detector dismounts very easily from the suction mount with a push of a button.  Overall, I am very satisfied with it and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: An elegant gadget
Reviews.Author: Cannonxyz
Reviews.Content: A surprisingly elegant gadget. The suction cup mount works better than I expected and the unit itself is not as obvious from the outside as I imagined it might be. The interior of my Camaro SS is black so it blends in nicely. The power cord is mildly obnoxious as it goes from the radar detector which is mounted dead center on my front window all the way down the center console...just mildly obnoxious though. There are 3 main modes. 2 for city driving and one for highway. The radar detector goes off all the time no matter what modei have it set to. If it were accurate there would be law enforcement on every street corner with a radar detector. The real benefit of this gadget is that it is constantly reminding me to slow down. So even if it gives many false alarms it is a good method to get me to take my foot of the gas pedal. Alternatively, you can just drive with your wife or girlfriend as she is probably equally efficient at reminding you what the speed limit is.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Everything
Reviews.Content: After spending to much money on my last two speeding tickets I decided to make this investment. I've had it for quite a while now and it does go off a lot for motion doors and school buses where I live. But it has picked up the policia from really far away, even when hiding on the other side of bridges, but I do find myself driving slower just having this in my car, for some reason it just makes me do so.

Reviews.Title: it works
Reviews.Author: kbp
Reviews.Content: It works pretty good. I tried it on numerous long distance trips as I try to stay within speed limit in the city.The only con is an excessive beeping when it comes to non-radar objects.

Reviews.Title: like most others
Reviews.Author: john czarnik
Reviews.Content: like most radar detectors, this one also gives many false warnings. not a knock on this particular radar, i mean most ALL radar detectors. once you "learn" the different sounds/warnings at the same areas all the time, you'll know when it is really a cop up ahead. wish all radars were better.the cobra is great for me, loud enough, bright enough, although like others have stated, unless your window angle - dash board line up for it to rest on, the suction cups can't hold it up by themselves.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS
Reviews.Author: Joey
Reviews.Content: I bought this radar and payed for itself within the first week. It detects cops awesome and even other specific signals. the other included features work well and may be a bit sensitive at first but with minor adjustments you can get it just right. Great radar.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: coolkid
Reviews.Content: This cobra radar works great. I had a few radar detectors in the past but this one is the best, I messed around with the bands and its the bomb

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 9845
Reviews.Author: dale c gibson
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, follow factory directions when setting up for first use. This product covers all aspects of radar detection in one small , easy to identify solution.

Reviews.Title: Good Radar for the price
Reviews.Author: A. Negron
Reviews.Content: This radar definitely works well. Sometimes a bit too well with Pop-Up enabled it gives some false alerts. But for the cost it is great and I would buy another. This is my third Cobra radar over the years and I am happy with its performance. People need to realize cops do not have their radars on all the time so the radar wont pick them up and if he just turns it on as you fly by it'll be too late. I'm happy with it and has already kept me out of a couple tickets.

Reviews.Title: Overwhelmed
Reviews.Author: Rusty nail
Reviews.Content: Excellent very Happy best dector I've ever owned. Picks up all bands of radar more then enough time to slow down.

Reviews.Title: Nice Radar Detector
Reviews.Author: BHumprey
Reviews.Content: I searched all of the radar detectors offered through Amazon. Of coarse some were more expensive and some cheaper,  this one was reasonably priced and has so far done a great job. Very few false alerts. For those who travel over the highways, I strongly recommened this piece.

Reviews.Title: Saved more in a week
Reviews.Author: Paul Lanzi
Reviews.Content: This Radar/Laser works great. In just two trips it's saved me from at least two or three tickets. All the features work great. The price was very good.

Reviews.Title: Cobra Radar Detector
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that the Cobra xrs 9345 detector is not bad. You must program it first to get the full use of it. I have done city and highway travel and I was getting a "POP" signal a couple of times but could not find where it was coming from. Not sure if it is picking up a signal from something else. I like the price and style and functions of it. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very accurate
Reviews.Author: Emil
Reviews.Content: Since I got this radar detector I have to say that I have yet to be pulled over because It always detects whats ahead of me.

Reviews.Title: Affordable Entry Level Radar
Reviews.Author: B. Nerney "BTN"
Reviews.Content: Currently, I already have a Valentine 1 and Cobra XRS-10G in my car, but I bought this for my girlfriend's Ford Fusion as a gift. I've tested it locally and on the state highways and works great for what she needs it for. Good distance alert, though not incredible, but for the pricing, it's excellent for a beginner level Radar Detector.Shipping, always, prompt!

Reviews.Title: Ticket Free
Reviews.Author: Chief
Reviews.Content: The Cobra XRS 9745 worked very well.  I just completed a 15 day road trip through 15 different states.  The detector performed well with every type of radar including laser.  This is my third Cobra radar detector.

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 15 band Radar Detector
Reviews.Author: mogie23
Reviews.Content: Bought this product due to traveling long distances multiple times a month. Product does exactly what it states it does. It's saved me from getting pulled over frequently. With all the traveling I do it's also a great help to have the built in compass.Highly recommend to all travelers!

Reviews.Title: Cobra XRS 9645
Reviews.Author: radaroreilly
Reviews.Content: This detector is an improvement over my previous 6 band Cobra units.  It is larger than those units and takes a little more room to hard wire mount at top of windshield.It does not come with a straight power cord, but I was able to use the cord from my existing Cobra mount.The compass works fine.I get a lot of "Pop" signals and have no idea where they are coming from.  all other bands seem to work fine.

Reviews.Title: great product for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Palacios
Reviews.Content: - Arrived on time.- Works very good- Looks good- my grilfriend stole it so i had to buy another one XRS-9945 which is as great, but even better lookingRP

Reviews.Title: Awesome unit!!
Reviews.Author: P. Cook
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this little unit. It's cheap enough where if you want a unit that's incredibly good but you just want to plug it in and go: it's great! This one you can also tailor 50 ways from Sunday too, which is incredibly powerful for more advanced units.One thing that surprised me, it also detects trains nearby! I had no idea about this until the alarm went off and sure enough, there was a train approaching. It has all the bells and whistles you will EVER need. I'm very very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Cobra xrs-9445
Reviews.Author: Bill C. Youngquist
Reviews.Content: Owned for about 1 year . Overall I am happy with Product its paid for itself many times. I use them more to remind me to pay attention not to speed. There are false warnings 35% of the time.

Reviews.Title: Saved me money
Reviews.Author: Jon Childers
Reviews.Content: This has been a great tool.I travel 660 miles a week to and from work and  see around 20 cops each week and it has never failed me.Love the compass in it makes it real nice.

Reviews.Title: best ever
Reviews.Author: todd
Reviews.Content: if there  a cop with radar anywhere in front of you you'll know . if you set it right you wont get  stopped but getting it  right is key  i now see all of them hiding in there little nooks and crannies and so wll you i am sure there are better ones out there  but to me i paid 102.00 to my place and its saved me 4 times the next day out  and  at 209.00 a pop i am happy with what i got

Reviews.Title: Nice...
Reviews.Author: R. Savola
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this Cobra XRS9445. For the price it is an excellent product. I typically don't speed, but I do want to know where the radar is. After searching around the internet for information, I found this one to be well worth the price in comparison to so many others well over $200. The intellimute and Intellimute Pro functions are something interesting to play with and in time, as I get used to working with it and understanding how I will use it, I can see that they may be very useful. Controls are easy to use and understand. The display is large enough to see clearly and interpret, and with voice alerts, its just that much more easy to understand without taking your eyes off the road. No more deciphering a tone to figure out what type of radar just hit you. This was purchased to replace an old Bell 300i (ancient). In comparison, this has very few false warnings. So far, very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: rosterga@bigfoot.com
Reviews.Content: I am generally satisfied with the detector and I knew I was not purchasing the top end in radar detectors.  It sometimes misidentifies bands, but who cares, if it is still identifying a radar.  Ramp up seems to be somewhat slower than I would expect.  The special feature that led me to purchase this item was Intellimute, but so far I haven't been able to get it to work.  I will try it in a second car today.  Customer service on the phone is poor.  With all of the above said, I am quite happy with the detector. It generally does what I need it to do and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Great Radar Detector
Reviews.Author: Hugh T. Cook
Reviews.Content: The best Radar detector I have every had.  I have seen it detect a police radar unit over 2 miles.  The voice alert really helps when you can not take your eyes off the road.

Reviews.Title: It is worth to have it with the price
Reviews.Author: S. Holmes "RD lover"
